poem:
Title: Elegy for Lost Swimmers

Raw sewage be the requiem,
For two thousand finned souls.
Oh, the price of negligence,
Echoes in every silvery toll.

Unseen alarm of verdant dawn,
No rescuers came to save.
The sinewy Shawford dances on,
Flowing over sunken graves.

Industry's unchecked maw devours,
Trout and dream both dashed.
A bleak reminder, in this hour,
Of natures wealth, now trashed.
